channel.title: CyberNetSec - IoT Security
channel.description: Latest iot security threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: Zero-Day in End-of-Life D-Link Routers Actively Exploited; No Patch Will Be Released
item.description:
A critical zero-day command injection vulnerability, CVE-2026-0625, is being actively exploited in the wild, affecting multiple end-of-life (EOL) D-Link DSL router models. The flaw, rated 9.3 on the CVSS scale, allows unauthenticated remote attackers to execute arbitrary code by sending a malicious ...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack, IoT Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: Kimwolf Botnet Hijacks 2M Android Devices via Proxy Networks
item.description:
The Kimwolf botnet has rapidly expanded to infect over 2 million devices worldwide, primarily targeting low-cost Android-based TV and streaming boxes. Active since at least mid-2025, the botnet operators monetize their network by launching large-scale DDoS attacks, surreptitiously installing applica...

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Cyberattack, IoT Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: Flaws in Airoha Bluetooth Chips Expose Headphones from Sony, Bose to Hijacking
item.description:
A set of critical vulnerabilities has been disclosed in Bluetooth System-on-Chips (SoCs) from Airoha, a major supplier for popular headphone brands including Sony, Bose, and JBL. The flaws, tracked up to CVE-2025-20702, exist in an unauthenticated diagnostic protocol called RACE. An attacker within ...

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, IoT Security, Mobile Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: Petlibro Smart Feeder API Flaw Lets Anyone Control Devices, Access Cameras
item.description:
A serious improper access control vulnerability, CVE-2025-3653, has been found in the backend API for Petlibro's smart pet feeders. The flaw allows a remote attacker to take full control of any Petlibro device simply by sending its serial number to the API, with no authentication required. A success...

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, IoT Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: "Aisuru" Botnet Shatters Records with 29.7 Tbps DDoS Attack
item.description:
A powerful botnet-for-hire service named "Aisuru" has emerged as a major global threat, responsible for a new record-breaking Distributed Denial-of-Service (DDoS) attack peaking at 29.7 Terabits per second (Tbps). The botnet, which leverages millions of compromised Internet of Things (IoT) devices a...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Cyberattack, Malware, IoT Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: Critical Flaw in WHILL Wheelchairs Allows Remote Hijacking via Bluetooth
item.description:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has issued an advisory for a critical vulnerability, CVE-2025-14346, in WHILL electric wheelchairs. The flaw, rated 9.8 on the CVSS scale, stems from a missing authentication mechanism over Bluetooth. It allows an attacker within Bluet...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, IoT Security, Industrial Control Systems

Read Full Article →

item.title: New 'Broadside' Botnet Exploits DVRs to Target Maritime Logistics
item.description:
A new, sophisticated variant of the Mirai botnet, dubbed "Broadside," is actively exploiting a command injection vulnerability (CVE-2024-3721) in TBK Digital Video Recorder (DVR) devices. According to research from Cydome, the campaign specifically targets the maritime logistics sector, where these ...

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Industrial Control Systems, IoT Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: Pwn2Own Day 1: Hackers Net $522K for 34 Zero-Days in SOHO Devices
item.description:
The first day of Trend Micro's Pwn2Own Ireland 2025 competition was a resounding success for security researchers, who earned a total of $522,500 for demonstrating 34 unique zero-day vulnerabilities. In a stunning display, every single one of the 17 scheduled attempts against popular SOHO devices—in...

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, IoT Security, Threat Intelligence
